treatment.description: Twigs eglandular-hairy, sessile glands beneath. Petioles 4–8 mm, eglandular-hairy, sessile glands beneath. Inflorescences: immature inflorescence axis 1.5–2 cm, rachis eglandular-hairy, sessile glands beneath; branches slender; bracts eglandular-hairy, sessile glands beneath.
treatment.habitat: Closed-cone conifer chaparral on serpentine soil
treatment.discussion: Subspecies sublaevis occurs in the southern outer North Coast Range between Cazadero and Healdsberg, Sonoma County.
